sourcing.instructions: Co: Purchase from a chemical supplier or online store. Mn: Obtain from a metal supplier or online marketplace. P: Available from a chemical supplier. Tc: Buy from a specialty supplier of rare elements or online.
steps: Co: Purchase from a chemical supplier or online store. Mn: Obtain from a metal supplier or online marketplace. P: Available from a chemical supplier. Tc: Buy from a specialty supplier of rare elements or online.

1. Measure 12.5 g of cobalt (Co) powder and place it in a clean mixing bowl. 2. Add 25 g of manganese (Mn) powder to the bowl. 3. Include 10 g of phosphorus (P) powder in the mixture. 4. Finally, add 15 g of technetium (Tc) powder. 5. Mix the powders thoroughly using a spatula or a powder mixer for about 10 minutes to ensure a homogenous blend.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Measure 12.5 g of cobalt (Co) powder and place it in a clean mixing bowl. 2. Add 25 g of manganese (Mn) powder to the bowl. 3. Include 10 g of phosphorus (P) powder in the mixture. 4. Finally, add 15 g of technetium (Tc) powder. 5. Mix the powders thoroughly using a spatula or a powder mixer for about 10 minutes to ensure a homogenous blend.

steps: 1. Transfer the mixed powder into a suitable crucible. 2. Preheat a furnace to 1200°C. 3. Once the temperature is reached, place the crucible inside the furnace and hold for 2 hours to allow for full reaction and bonding of materials.
heating.raw_text: 1. Transfer the mixed powder into a suitable crucible. 2. Preheat a furnace to 1200°C. 3. Once the temperature is reached, place the crucible inside the furnace and hold for 2 hours to allow for full reaction and bonding of materials.

steps: 1. After 2 hours, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool naturally to room temperature (approximately 3-4 hours). 2. Do not open the furnace door until it has cooled down to prevent oxidation.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After 2 hours, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool naturally to room temperature (approximately 3-4 hours). 2. Do not open the furnace door until it has cooled down to prevent oxidation.

steps: 1. Once cooled, carefully remove the crucible from the furnace. 2. Remove the solid sample from the crucible using a spatula. 3. Use a fine-grit sandpaper to smooth out the edges of the solid piece. 4. Optionally, seal the surface with a clear varnish or epoxy resin to enhance durability and protect against oxidation.
